name: valkey
description: Valkey is an open-source, Redis-compatible in-memory key-value store designed as a community-driven successor. It offers high performance and is operated via command-line tools and Redis protocol clients.
features: Redis compatibility: Drop-in replacement for Redis with full protocol compatibility.
In-memory storage: Store data in memory for microsecond latency and high throughput.
Data structures: Support strings, lists, sets, sorted sets, hashes, and more.
Persistence: Persist data to disk with RDB snapshots and AOF logging for durability.
Replication: Set up primary-replica replication for high availability and read scaling.
Pub/sub messaging: Implement real-time messaging with publish/subscribe channels.
Transactions: Execute multiple commands atomically with MULTI/EXEC transactions.
Lua scripting: Run server-side Lua scripts for complex operations and atomic workflows.
Clustering: Scale horizontally with automatic sharding across multiple nodes.
High performance: Handle millions of operations per second with optimized C implementation.
Community-driven: Open-source project maintained by the community without vendor lock-in.
CLI tools: Manage and interact with the server using command-line tools and clients.
